RECORD.TEXT: 901162406 88620362 098833 4/14/1991 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed DIS 04/14/1991 Report Status : Discharge Date : 04/17/1991 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : VAGINAL CANCER . PROCEDURE : VAGINAL CYLINDER PLACEMENT 4/15/91 . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 76-year-old woman with a history of multiple medical problems who presented with vaginal bleeding . She underwent treatment with external beam radiation therapy and then presented for a vaginal cylinder boost . The patient was admitted on 4/14/91 and at that time was noted to have a creatinine of 1.5 . After IV hydration , her creatinine returned to normal . A vaginal cylinder radiation implant was then inserted and remained in place for 27 hours delivering 2255 centrigray . She tolerated this well . The implant was removed and she was discharged home on 4/17/91 with plans for follow-up by Dr. Horner . She was in good condition upon discharge . LL162/6571 AUNI HORNER , M.D. WA44 D : 10/05/91 Batch : 8999 Report : U5657E11 T : Dicatated By : TIANSHA KOTE , M.D. OZ06 [ report_end ]
